      public void addNewFunction(Function function)
      Add a function to the program code. If the added function is the main function, the initial jump is automatically patched.
      Parameters:
      function - Function to add to the code

      Parameters:

      Emit a return instruction.
      Parameters:
      resultSize - Size in words of the result
      argSize - Size of the function arguments
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitHaltInstruction

      public Instruction emitHaltInstruction()
      Emit a halt instruction, which terminates the program execution.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitBoundsCheck

      public void emitBoundsCheck(int lowerBound, int upperBound)
      Generates code that throws an error when the top stack value is smaller than lowerBound or greater than or equal to upperBound. Otherwise, the topmost stack element is left untouched.
      Parameters:
      lowerBound - Minimum value (inclusive)
      upperBound - Maximum value (exclusive)

    • addDeclaredEntity

      public void addDeclaredEntity(Declaration decl)
      Add a variable or constant to the local scope.
      Parameters:
      decl - Declared Entity to add

      Emit a load instruction, to load a single boolean value onto the stack.
      Parameters:
      value - Value of the boolean
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • loadLocalValue

      public Instruction loadLocalValue(int wordSize, int offset)
      Emit a load instruction for an entity local to the function. Addressing on the stack will be relative to register LB.
      Parameters:
      wordSize - Number of words to load
      offset - Offset from LB.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction.

    • loadValue

      public Instruction loadValue(Register register, int wordSize, int offset)
      Emit a load instruction for an entity. Addressing on the stack will be relative to the given register.
      Parameters:
      register - Register used for address resolution
      wordSize - Number of words to load
      offset - Offset from the given Register
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • loadAddress

      public Instruction loadAddress(Register register, int offset)
      Load an address relative to a register onto the stack. Loaded address equals register value + offset.
      Parameters:
      register - Base register
      offset - Offset from the register
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • loadFromStackAddress

      public Instruction loadFromStackAddress(int wordSize)
      Emit a load instruction which uses the value on top of the stack as address and loads the given number of words.
      Parameters:
      wordSize - The number of words to load
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • storeToStackAddress

      public Instruction storeToStackAddress(int wordSize)
      Emit a store instruction which stores the given number of words to the address on top of the stack.
      Parameters:
      wordSize - The number of words to store
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

      offset - Offset from LB
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • storeValue

      public Instruction storeValue(Register register, int wordSize, int offset)
      Emit a store instruction for an entity. Addressing on the stack will be relative to a given register.
      Parameters:
      register - Register
      wordSize - Number of words to store
      offset - Offset from given register
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitPop

      public Instruction emitPop(int resultSize, int popSize)
      Emit a pop instruction. The pop instruction pops a result of size resultSize from the stack, deletes another popSize words from the stack and pushes the result back on the stack.
      Parameters:
      resultSize - Size of the result
      popSize - Number of words to delete
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitPush

      public Instruction emitPush(int size)
      Emit a push instruction pushing size uninitialized words on the stack.
      Parameters:
      size - Number of words to push
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

      public Instruction emitJump(int address)
      Emit an unconditional jump to the given code address.
      Parameters:
      address - The target code address
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

      Emit a conditional jump to the given code address under the given condition.
      Parameters:
      condition - The condition of the jump
      address - The target code address
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

      address - The target code address

      Patch a jump-instruction to point to a new address.
      Parameters:

      newAddress - The new address

    • emitErr

      public Instruction emitErr()
      Emits a call to the Primitive.err primitive, which consumes a string id to be used as error message.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitIntegerNegation

      public Instruction emitIntegerNegation()
      Emits an Integer Negation, which consumes the topmost Element of the stack, and pushes its Negation onto the stack. The consumed Element is interpreted as Integer Number.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitIntegerMultiplication

      public Instruction emitIntegerMultiplication()
      Emits an Integer Multiplication, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, multiplies them and pushed the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitIntegerDivision

      public Instruction emitIntegerDivision()
      Emits an Integer Division, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, divides the lower one by the upper one, and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitIntegerAddition

      public Instruction emitIntegerAddition()
      Emits an Integer Addition, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, adds them up and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitIntegerSubtraction

      public Instruction emitIntegerSubtraction()
      Emits an Integer Subtraction, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, subtracts the upper one from the lower one and pushes the result to the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitIntegerExponentiation

      public Instruction emitIntegerExponentiation()
      Emits an Integer Exponentiation, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack. The topmost is interpreted as the power, the one below as base. The result is than pushed onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitIntegerComparison

      public Instruction emitIntegerComparison(Compare.Comparison comparison)
      Emits an Integer Comparison Operation, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, and pushes the Comparison Result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
      Parameters:
      comparison - Comparison Operator
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitFloatNegation

      public Instruction emitFloatNegation()
      Emits a Floating Point Negation, which consumes the topmost Element of the stack, and pushes its Negation onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Floating Point Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitFloatMultiplication

      public Instruction emitFloatMultiplication()
      Emits a Floating Point Multiplication, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, multiplies them and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Floating Point Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitFloatDivision

      public Instruction emitFloatDivision()
      Emits a Floating Point Division, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, divides the lower one by the upper one and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Floating Point Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

      public Instruction emitFloatAddition()
      Emits a Floating Point Addition, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, adds them up and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Floating Point Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitFloatSubtraction

      public Instruction emitFloatSubtraction()
      Emits a Floating Point Subtraction, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, subtracts the upper one from the lower one and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Floating Point Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

    • emitFloatExponentiation

      public Instruction emitFloatExponentiation()
      Emits a Float Exponentiation, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack. The topmost is interpreted as the power, the one below as base. The result is than pushed onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Float Numbers.
      Returns:
      The generated instruction

      public Instruction emitFloatComparison(Compare.Comparison comparison)

      Parameters:
      comparison - Comparision Operator
      Returns:
      The generated instruction
